event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error was detected within a Clock chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
This message indicates a diagnosis of a fatal error being detected within a Clock chip.

    
   SPARC Enterprise M8000 platforms:

      The platform will be powered down and becomes unbootable.



   SPARC Enterprise M9000-32 platforms:

      Clock Unit with the fault will be deconfigured.

         If the fault is detected on the active Clock Unit and the standby Clock Unit is:

            Operational, then the platform will be reset;
            Non-Operational, then the platform will be powered down and becomes unbootable.

         If the fault is detected on the standby Clock Unit, which can only happen
         during platform powerup, then no action is taken.



   SPARC Enterprise M9000-64 platforms:

      Clock Unit with the fault and its partner Clock Unit on the expansion cabinet are deconfigured.
       
         If the fault is detected on the active Clock Unit and the standby Clock Unit is:

            Operational, then the platform will be reset and a clock failover will occur;
            Non-Operational, then the platform will be powered down and becomes unbootable.

         If the fault is detected on the standby Clock Unit, which can only happen
         during platform powerup, then no action is taken.



The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 14:47:32 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: 12ce1f2b-dd53-4d11-a288-2cacc1f809bd
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8000-33 for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8000-33, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 14:47:32 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 12ce1f2b-dd53-4d11-a288-2cacc1f809bd
   DESC: A fatal error was detected within a Clock chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8000-33 for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The platform will be reset. If there is redundant clock capability, an attempt will be made to deconfigure
   the active Clock Unit from service.
   IMPACT: If the platform lacks redundant clock capability, the platform will be powered down and will not
   power up. If the platform has redundant clock capability, the platform will be reset and the
   faulty Clock Unit will be deconfigured during recovery.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
 

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u 12ce1f2b-dd53-4d11-a288-2cacc1f809bd

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 27 14:47:32.9084 12ce1f2b-dd53-4d11-a288-2cacc1f809bd SCF-8000-33
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.clk.fe

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/clku=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/clku=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                             server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0638K200:
                             part=CA06620-D321 A5:revision=0201/component=/CLKU_B#0



Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: If the platform lacks redundant clock capability, the platform will be powered down and will not power up. If the platform has redundant clock capability, the platform will be reset and the faulty Clock Unit will be deconfigured during recovery.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The platform will be reset. If there is redundant clock capability, an attempt will be made to deconfigure the active Clock Unit from service.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error detected within a Clock chip.
